title: How to Make a Website With Word

steps.title: Click File > Save as Webpage.
steps.content: Click File > Save as Webpage. In Office 2007, click the Office button > Save As >Other Formats.

steps.title: Save your page as index.html.
steps.content: Save your page as index.html. In 2007, change "Save as type" to "Web Page."

steps.title: You will see now that the page doesn't look like a normal Word document - you are now in web layout mode.
steps.content: You will see now that the page doesn't look like a normal Word document - you are now in web layout mode.

steps.title: Add some additional text; try typing "This is my home page."
steps.content: Add some additional text; try typing "This is my home page."

steps.title: Save your work frequently (just click the save icon - Word will remember it's a web page.
steps.content: Save your work frequently (just click the save icon - Word will remember it's a web page. )

steps.title: Do the same to make the other pages (keep reading to make a hyperlink).
steps.content: Do the same to make the other pages (keep reading to make a hyperlink).

steps.title: Type "Link to homepage" under the text.
steps.content: Type "Link to homepage" under the text.

steps.title: When you find it, select it and click OK.
steps.content: When you find it, select it and click OK.

steps.title: Note that you have just created a hyperlink.
steps.content: Note that you have just created a hyperlink. This means that in a browser you can click that hyperlink and go to another page in your site.

steps.title: You can add a hyperlink to another website - in the "Insert Hyperlink" dialog, in the "Address" text box, type the address of the web page.
steps.content: You can add a hyperlink to another website - in the "Insert Hyperlink" dialog, in the "Address" text box, type the address of the web page.

steps.title: Keep doing this until your website is complete!
steps.content: Keep doing this until your website is complete!

steps.title: Good job making your website.
steps.content: Good job making your website. Remember the information in the introduction.
